premises: If a plant receives sunlight, then it performs photosynthesis
incorrect conclusions: The plant does not perform photosynthesis
If the plant performs photosynthesis, then it receives sunlight
If the plant does not perform photosynthesis, then it receives sunlight
If the plant does not receive sunlight, then it does not perform photosynthesis

premises: If an animal eats, then it gains energy
incorrect conclusions: The animal does not gain energy
If the animal gains energy, then it eats
If the animal does not gain energy, then it eats
If the animal does not eat, then it does not gain energy

premises: If a cell undergoes mitosis, then it divides
incorrect conclusions: If the cell divides, then it undergoes mitosis
If the cell does not divide, then it undergoes mitosis
If the cell does not undergo mitosis, then it does not divide
